CatDescriptText: Mr. Blanch McKoy, steelworker, Homestead plant, 4612 Sylvan Avenue, Homewood, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I think he should intervene and get the mills back to work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Blanch McKoy wearing light colored button down plaid collared shirt and light colored hat, standing on sidewalk in front of open door of decorative brick building
